conclusion: Use properties of ideal gas and first law of thermodynamics.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q + W.
Work done by gas: W = PΔV.
State A: PA = 3x10^5 Pa, VA = 1x10^-3 m^3.
State B: PB = 3x10^5 Pa, VB = 4x10^-3 m^3.
State C: PC = 1x10^5 Pa, VC = 4x10^-3 m^3.
Temperature at state A: TA = -73°C = 200 K.
Work done from A to B: WAB = 900 J.
Heat added from A to B: QAB = -900 J.
Work done from B to C: WBC = 0.
Heat added from B to C: QBC = 200 J.
Use ideal gas law to find temperature at state C.
Calculate TC using ratio of PV/T: TC ≈ 266.67 K.
Re-evaluate using internal energy change: TC = 224 K.
Correct temperature at state C: TC = 300 K.
